newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan stocks end down as PTCL falls.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan stocks end down as PTCL falls.

text.p: Pakistan stocks ended down on Monday as telecom utility Pakistan Telecommunications Co Ltd shares slipped ahead of the company's book closure on June 10, which hurt market sentiment, dealers said.
The index fell 8.43 points, or 0.54 percent, to end at 1,539.52. Losers led gainers 206 to 61. PTCL fell 0.55 rupees to 24.35.
Investors were worried that the dividend to be set by PTCL would be too low, dealers said.
PTCL announced a dividend of only 6.0 percent for the year ending June 1996.
"Investors are unloading PTCL before the company's book closure in June to avoid blocking of cash," dealer Shakil Anwar said.
"PTCL has under-performed the market for sometime," dealer Ather Raouf said.
